metadata.Title: CVE-2017-17479 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In OpenJPEG 2.3.0, a stack-based buffer overflow was discovered in the pgxtoimage function in jpwl/convert.c. The vulnerability causes an out-of-bounds write, which may lead to remote denial of service or possibly remote code execution.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-17479` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenjp2-7 - 2.4.0-6
libopenjp2-tools - 2.4.0-6
libopenjp3d-tools - 2.4.0-6
libopenjp3d7 - 2.4.0-6
libopenjpip-dec-server - 2.4.0-6
libopenjpip-server - 2.4.0-6
libopenjpip-viewer - 2.4.0-6
libopenjpip7 - 2.4.0-6
No subscription required

notes.Note: ccdm94> the commit which fixed this CVE also fixes CVE-2017-17480.

criterions.comment: openjpeg2 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.4.0-6').
